business.headline: How to invest in pharma and IT stocks during current slowdownWith the US announcing fresh tariffs on branded drugs and uncertainty around H-1B visa rules, both sectors are experiencing headwinds.

India-US trade talks advance amid tariff and energy discussionsIndia-US trade discussions are gaining momentum, with both nations exploring ways to enhance economic cooperation, address tariffs, and boost energy trade.

Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

Sensex tanks 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?By 2:37 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had lost 782.71 points to trade at 80,376.97, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 247.10 points to 24,643.75. Both indices were on track to end the week in negative territory.

Investors brace for IPO wave as 18 public listings hit Dalal Street next weekThe four mainboard IPOs opening next week together aim to raise over Rs 850 crore. Apart from them, 14 SME IPOs will also open for bidding next week.

Why more insurance policyholders are turning to private grievance platformsAs claim rejections soar and official channels frustrate, policyholders turn to private grievance platforms. Experts warn regulatory reform and competent brokers could restore trust in India's struggling insurance system.

From EMIs to assets: How home loans are creating India's new wealth generationIn India, home loans are doing more than financing houses—they are quietly shaping the country's next generation of wealth. Every EMI paid is becoming a step toward financial growth and stability.

Crypto in slump. 3 reasons why Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin are strugglingThe cryptocurrency market is struggling, and major tokens are taking the hit. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin have all dropped as investors react to a mix of macroeconomic uncertainty, liquidations, and upcoming market events.

EPFO 3.0 roll-out likely delayed, ATM withdrawals pushed to 2026The wait for EPFO 3.0 just got longer. While the update is set to make provident fund services more seamless, its highlight feature, ATM withdrawals, is now likely to come into effect in 2026.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.

entertainment.headline: The Ba***ds of Bollywood feels like one big party with no plot to go home to Aryan Khan's debut series attempts to reveal Bollywood's underbelly including nepotism and scandals. The show's chaotic narrative and overplayed themes sparked mixed reactions among viewers.

Boney Kapoor says ex-wife Mona Shourie bought his and Sridevi's wedding rings Boney Kapoor discusses the challenges of balancing two families and the effect on his children. Kapoor reveals his first wife Mona Shourie Kapoor bought the wedding rings for both him and Sridevi.

12th Fail is the plot twist no one anticipated for Vikrant Massey and Bollywood '12th Fail', which was a sleeper hit at the time of its release, won big at the 71st National Awards. The film not only won an award in the Best Feature Film category, but also got Vikrant Massey recognition for his acting performance.

Dinesh Yadav recalls when Jaya Bachchan beat him with stick on Bhojpuri film set Actor Dinesh Lal Yadav revealed how Jaya Bachchan actually hit him with a stick during a film shoot. The incident happened on the set of Bhojpuri film 'Ganga Devi' (2012).
Sohum Shah's Tumbbad 2 to go on floors next year Sohum Shah Films has partnered with Pen Studios to produce 'Tumbbad 2', the sequel to the acclaimed 2018 film.

Chocolate boy to chameleon: Choi Woo-shik's evolving screen journey In this week's K-fix, we discover how Choi Woo-shik, South Korea's Chocolate Boy, redefined versatility with standout roles in 'Parasite', 'Our Beloved Summer', 'The Witch' and more.

It's like having a daughter: Nagarjuna on his bond with daughter-in-law Sobhita Actor Nagarjuna expressed heartfelt admiration for his daughter-in-law Sobhita Dhulipala, highlighting their warm bond and shared interests since her marriage to Naga Chaitanya. The couple's intimate wedding took place in Hyderabad last year.

AP Dhillon announces third India tour, Mumbai VVIP tickets priced at Rs 6.25 lakh Singer AP Dhillon to begin third India tour in December, covering eight major cities, including a Mumbai show that features a record-breaking VVIP ticket price at Rs 6.25 lakh.

Fake and mischievous: Shilpa Shetty denies Rs 15-crore payment from Raj Kundra Shilpa Shetty has refuted claims that she received Rs 15 crore from her husband, Raj Kundra, almost a decade ago. This comes as EOW is investigating a Rs 60-crore cheating case linked to Kundra and Shetty.

Ashneer Grover falls prey to fake Bigg Boss 19 casting call Ashneer Grover shared a screenshot on social media and alerted fans about a fake casting invitation for 'Bigg Boss 19'. A source close to the development said that the entrepreneur cannot be a part of the Salman Khan-hosted reality show.

Balti review: Shane Nigam, Shanthanu's promising crime drama drowns in clichesRelease Date:Fri Sep 26, 2025 Balti movie review: Directed by Unni Sivalingam, 'Balti' is an action drama starring Shane Nigam and Shanthanu Bhagyaraj. While its dynamic characters are intriguing, the film ultimately suffers from overused cliches and a predictable storyline.

Exclusive: Mahesh Bhatt breaks silence on Pooja Bhatt kiss controversy Mahesh Bhatt shared his thoughts on the infamous kiss controversy with daughter Pooja Bhatt. He reflected on how hardships strengthened their bond and shaped their lives.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood's incest-ridden ending: Aryan Khan dares a taboo 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' ends with a shocking incest twist that departs from mainstream storytelling norms. Aryan Khan's bold climax dares a Bollywood taboo, pushing screen entertainment into forbidden, uncharted territory.

Vicky Kaushal, Varun Dhawan's Perfect gym reel is pure Punjabi munda vibe Vicky Kaushal and Varun Dhawan have set social media abuzz with a lively reel dancing to Guru Randhawa's Punjabi track 'Perfect'. The upbeat video, shot in a gym, has fans and celebrities praising the perfect sync of the two stars as the film gears up for 'Sunny Sanskari's' October 2 release.

Shinchan Kasukabe Dancers review: Anime mischief gets an Indian whiffRelease Date:Fri Sep 26, 2025 Shinchan Kasukabe Dancers review: Chaos, comedy, and heartfelt moments abound as Shinchan brings mischief and Indian flavour to his latest adventure.

Bobby Deol backs Sandeep Reddy Vanga's grey characters, avoids debate on his films Actor Bobby Deol recently recalled his working experience with director Sandeep Reddy Vanga in Animal. He refused to react to the debate over the kind of films the 'Animal' director makes.

One Battle After Another review: Leonardo DiCaprio leads Paul Anderson's wild rideRelease Date:Fri Sep 26, 2025 Paul Thomas Anderson's 'One Battle After Another' brings political satire and pulpy action together. The film explores family ties and rebellion with chaotic energy and bold performances.

Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19 sued for alleged unauthorised use of Chikni Chameli Hosted by Bollywood superstar Salman Khan, 'Bigg Boss 19' has been sued for using two Bollywood songs without proper authorisation. The show allegedly faces a lawsuit of Rs 2 crore for using 'Chikni Chameli' and 'Dhat Teri Ki.'

Aryan Khan has been through a lot, which no child should ever go: Bobby Deol Bobby Deol acknowledged that Aryan Khan has faced significant challenges following his directorial debut with 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. This comes after Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against Shah Rukh Khan, Red Chillies Entertainment, and Netflix.

general news.headline: Careless, unacceptable: India blasts Nato chief over 'Modi called Putin' remarkIndia slammed Nato chief Mark Rutte for claiming that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had spoken directly with Russian President Vladimir Putin on the matter.

ICC fines Haris for provocative gesture in Ind vs Pak, Farhan let off with warningPakistan fast bowler Haris Rauf has been fined 30 percent of his match fees for a provocative gesture during the high-voltage Asia Cup Super Four game against India in Dubai on September 21.

Sonam Wangchuk arrested days after violent statehood protests in LadakhThe government blamed Wangchuk for the unrest, alleging his "provocative statements" and the actions of "politically motivated" groups unhappy with ongoing negotiations between officials and Ladakhi representatives had incited protesters.

Pak set to disappoint US, angry Trump post coming soon, ex-Indian diplomat predictsSeconding Ajay Bisaria, another senior Indian diplomat, Jawed Ashraf, said that every new US administration is initially seduced by Pakistan, only to end in disappointment – a pattern seen with Bush, Obama, and now likely to repeat with Trump.

Blood and snow: How Ladakh became a part of IndiaIt was the bravery and military campaign of Zorawar Singh Kahluria, a General of Jammu king Gulab Singh, that first brought Ladakh into the Dogra fold in 1834. The sale of Jammu and Kashmir by the British to Gulab Singh in 1846, and his great-grandson Hari Singh's signing of the treaty of accession in 1947, made Ladakh an integral part of India.

Farhan says gunshot gesture not political in ICC hearing: Dhoni, Kohli have done sameSahibzada Farhan clarified that his on-field celebration against India in the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 clash on Sunday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium was cultural, not politically motivated.

Hardik Singh mocks Pakistan hockey team with fighter jet gesture, says no rivalryIndia vice-captain Hardik Singh claimed that the rivalry between India and Pakistan doesn't exist in hockey anymore. Hardik mocked the Pakistan team using the fighter jet gesture while talking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai.

Given ice instead of water for meds: Harrowing tale of grandmother deported by USA 73-year-old Sikh grandmother, who had lived in the US for over three decades, was denied food and medicine during detention and handed only a plate of ice when she asked for water to take her medicine.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood's incest-ridden ending: Aryan Khan dares a taboo'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' ends with a shocking incest twist that departs from mainstream storytelling norms. Aryan Khan's bold climax dares a Bollywood taboo, pushing screen entertainment into forbidden, uncharted territory.

Delhi baba, accused of sex assault, denied pre-arrest bail in fraud caseSwami Chaitanyananda Saraswati has been accused of committing forgery and diverting money belonging to a trust. His plea seeking anticipatory bail in the case was rejected by a Delhi court.

Will India lead or lag in the global race for artificial intelligence?At the India Today Conclave session titled 'The AI Revolution: Pivot or Perish', leading voices debated India's strengths, weaknesses, and future in artificial intelligence. While the US and China currently lead the field, experts agreed that India's talent, data, and scale offer a real opportunity to close the gap, provided industry and government work in sync.
Will Putin's Su-57s replace Khrushchev's MiG-21s in India?The MiG-21's retirement from the Indian Air Force brings the focus back to HAL's Soviet-built Nasik aircraft assembly line.

Sorry Zubeen da, I misunderstood youI am sorry, I did not know any better, because social media, which can make people go viral overnight for the most trivial things, never brought forth the side of Zubeen, who was charitable, outspoken, and one who deeply loved his people, his Assam.

iPhone 17 Pro 'bhagwa' rocking in India as orange is new black marketThere were signs that the iPhone 17 Pro in Cosmic Orange — some Indian users are calling it "bhagwa" colour — would prove to be popular in India. After launch this has been confirmed, and so high is the demand for it that dealers are now selling it by charging extra for it.

Lalu's kidney spills RJD beansJust ahead of the Bihar Assembly election, a rift within the RJD's first family is out in the open. In 2022, Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, donated her kidney to him in a transplant done in Singapore. Now, questions are being asked if Rohini was actually the donor. While she hints the doubts were being created at the behest of Tejashwi Yadav's trusted aide, Sanjay Yadav, her eldest brother, Tej Pratap Yadav, has sided with her.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.

The Gucci glow-up: Alia Bhatt's boldest fashion era yetWith over a decade in the film industry, Alia's style has always been a source of inspiration - especially with her ethnic looks and effortlessly relatable choices. But ever since her Gucci contract, she's been pushing the envelope like never before, radiating a true global fashion appeal.

Iran, Russia sign mega nuclear deal, will build 4 power plants worth $25 billionIran and Russia have signed a $25 billion nuclear deal to build four new power plants. The agreement boosts Tehran-Moscow energy ties amid global sanctions pressure.

The MiG-21 truth: Pilots reveal the deadly power of F-16 killerFor over six decades, the MiG-21 defended India's skies and helped train generations of pilots. Yet, despite its reputation as a workhorse, upgrade and spares woes marred its legacy. As the Indian Air Force (IAF) restores its fleet of MiG-21, pilots who flew it defend the trusted war bird.

Can you destroy a Mercedes-Benz G-Class? We triedSUVs are born tough—or at least, that's how they should be. They're expected to take on every kind of terrain without hesitation. But can they really? Take the G-Class, for instance. With its high-end features and luxury touches, does it still have the grit and durability it was originally known for? Is it still the tough-as-nails SUV it was born to be? We set out to find out.

Shashi Tharoor's witty comeback to Suhel Seth's Oxford 'sole mate' remark goes viralOn X, Suhel Seth shared a picture from Oxford University, the site where the Oxford English Dictionary was created, and joked that the dictionary was Shashi Tharoor's "sole mate."

Why Indian elections are mostly free but rarely fairWhile Indian elections have become freer, they are much less fairer. At the heart of electoral democracy is the belief in a 'Level Playing Field' (LPL): every candidate and party who contests should begin from the same starting point. Instead, now we have a totally skewed race where those in power have a massive advantage over their rivals.

Court lets Priya Kapur file assets in sealed cover, asks parties not to leak willThe Delhi High Court allowed Priya Kapur to file late Sunjay Kapur's assets in a sealed cover while directing parties not to leak the will to the media.

Nat Sciver-Brunt, Alyssa Healy and Sophie Devine were also present at the meet.

After Bumrah lashes out, Kaif tries to defuse tension with pacer Former cricketer Mohammed Kaif clarified his comments on Jasprit Bumrah after the Indian pacer slammed him. Bumrah called Kaif's analysis on him as inaccurate and the former cricketer decided to quickly defuse the situation.

Pakistan women's captain imitates Haris Rauf's fighter jet gesture, video goes viral Pakistan women's captain Fatima Sana went viral after a video showed her imitating Haris Rauf's controversial fighter-jet gesture during the third ODI against South Africa in Lahore.

Haris Rauf pleads not guilty, tells ICC 6-0 gesture not aimed at India: Sources Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf pleaded not guilty infront of the ICC panel after his gestures during the India vs Pakistan Asia Cup Super 4s clash courted controversy.

KL Rahul 176, Sai Sudharsan 100 steer India A to big win vs Australia A Indian opener KL Rahul produced a sublime unbeaten 176, while Sai Sudharsan followed with a classy century, as India A pulled off a stunning chase against Australia A in the second unofficial Test in Kanpur. The Dhruv Jurel-led side chased down 413 runs in just 91.3 overs.

After taking Andhra job, Gary Stead accepts new role with New Zealand cricket After taking over as the new head coach of the Andhra state team, Gary Stead has accepted a role with New Zealand cricket and has become their high performance coach. Stead will be allowed to work outside of New Zealand cricket despite taking up the new job.

Stead will be allowed to work outside of New Zealand cricket despite taking up the new job.

Karun Nair WI series snub: Selectors moving on from batter, says Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik believes that the India selectors have moved on from Karun Nair after the Karnataka batter was dropped from the squad for the West Indies Test series. Karun was replaced by Devdutt Padikkal in the team.

Shubman Gill in awe of Smriti Mandhana: She has the lazy elegance of Damien MartynWomen's World Cup: Shubman Gill said Smriti Mandhana plays with the "lazy elegance" of former Australian batter Damien Martyn. Mandhana recently became India's fastest centurion in ODIs.

No Bumrah perks, but Mohammed Shami toiling to keep India comeback dream aliveIndia fast bowler Mohammed Shami is training behind the scenes, hoping to make an India comeback at the age of 35. People close to Shami have been infuriated by the preferential treatment given to some of the other players in the team.

Abhishek Sharma drops stylish Dubai pics, Guru Yuvraj has hilarious responseAbhishek Sharma's latest post on Instagram got a hilarious comment from his guru Yuvraj Singh, who decided to have some fun at the expense of his young disciple. Abhishek posted images from his free time in Dubai.

Ashes: Joe Root eyes beyond milestone 100 vs Australia, confident in different EnglandJoe Root promises England will approach the Ashes Down Under with a fresh mindset, that can toruble Australia. While a century in Australia remains elusive, his focus is on winning matches and reclaiming the urn.

PR Sreejesh reveals India senior team coach ambitions, wants World Cup gloryIn an exclusive interaction with India Today, PR Sreejesh said that he aims to coach the India men's senior team and win the World Cup with them. Sreejesh commented on his life after retirement, his mentor role with SG Pipers and much more.

IND vs WI: West Indies suffer big blow as Shamar Joseph ruled out of seriesWest Indies suffered a big blow ahead of the India Test series as Shamar Joseph has been ruled out of the Test series against India, which will begin on October 2. Shamar has been replaced by Johann Layne in the lineup.

His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

IND v SL preview: India face dead rubber dilemma ahead of Pakistan finalAsia Cup, IND vs SL Super 4 preview: With the final against Pakistan looming, India find themselves caught in the classic dead rubber dilemma — to experiment or to consolidate. Friday's clash with Sri Lanka may not alter the standings, but it offers India a chance to settle questions over form, sharpen their fielding, and build the rhythm they need for the big showdown.

Smriti Mandhana eyes more records after stellar Australia series: Stats PreviewSmriti Mandhana has delivered a stunning ODI series against Australia, breaking records with her explosive batting. She now aims for historic milestones at the upcoming Women's World Cup, raising expectations and excitement.

The Wall gets tougher: Sreejesh trades easygoing charm for coaching disciplineFrom being a chill goalkeeper on the field to being a strict taskmaster on the halfway line, PR Sreejesh tells India Today about his coaching style, mentor role with SG Pipers and his ultimate goal as the senior team coach.

Watch: Fans troll Pakistan for fielding blunder vs Bangladesh ahead of India finalPakistan survived a shaky fielding performance to beat Bangladesh by 11 runs in the Asia Cup Super 4, but a missed run-out sparked social media trolling ahead of their high-stakes final against India.

IND vs PAK final: Pakistan coach urges players to focus on cricket amid off-field rowAhead of the Asia Cup 2025 final, Pakistan head coach Mike Hesson urges players to concentrate on cricket and avoid distractions from recent controversies. India and Pakistan will clash for the third time in this tournament.

Abhishek Sharma powerplay successor to Rohit Sharma: Mohammad Kaif on India openerMohammed Kaif believes that Abhishek Sharma has stepped into Rohit Sharma's shoes as India's powerplay enforcer. With fearless batting and consistent runs in the Asia Cup 2025, the youngster is shaping into a match-winner at the very top.

Mike Hesson's blueprint: How Pakistan plan to challenge India in Asia Cup finalAsia Cup 2025: Head coach Mike Hesson said Pakistan are capable of toppling India in Sunday's final. However, the New Zealand tactician cautioned his players that there are no shortcuts against the world's No. 1 side, stressing that being "good enough for long enough" is the only path to success.

England rout India by 153 runs in Women's World Cup warm-up fixture in BengaluruNat Sciver-Brunt scored a sparkling century as England defeated India by 153 runs in their warm-up match. India suffered a setback with Arundhati Reddy's injury ahead of the World Cup.

Salman Agha confident of avenging previous defeats vs India in Asia Cup finalPakistan captain Salman Agha expresses confidence in his men to beat India in the Asia Cup 2025 final. India have beaten Pakistan in both matches of the Asia Cup 2025 so far.

41 years, 17 Asia Cups later, it's an India vs Pakistan finalIndia and Pakistan will meet in the Asia Cup 2025 final for the first time ever. Pakistan qualified for the final with an 11-run victory over Bangladesh in their last Super 4 clash.

Sloppy Pakistan survive sloppier Bangladesh to book final date vs IndiaAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan were far from their best with the bat in the virtual semi-final against Bangladesh, but their bowling came to the rescue. For the first time in Asia Cup history, India and Pakistan will meet in the final on Sunday, 28 September.

World Para Athletics Champs underway in Delhi with PM Modi's motivational messageIndia proudly hosts the World Para Athletics Championships 2025 with over 2,200 athletes from 100 countries. They become the fourth Asian nation to host the World Para Athletics Championships, following Qatar (2015), the UAE (2019), and Japan (2024).

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
